snippet: The state attorney general asserted that fraudulent use of the tracking system allowed Bank of America, Wells Fargo and JPMorgan Chase to avoid the need for recording mortgage transfers.
abstract: New York Attorney General Eric T Schneiderman sues Bank of America, Wells Fargo and JPMorgan Chase, asserting fraudulent use of an electronic mortgage database allowed them to avoid the need for recording mortgage transfers.
lead_paragraph: The state attorney general asserted that fraudulent use of the tracking system allowed Bank of America, Wells Fargo and JPMorgan Chase to avoid the need for recording mortgage transfers.
